mdRecord.dcterms:title: Penelope awaiting Ulysses’ return, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Payne, George (American stained glass artist, 19th century) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "A large stained-glass window depicts Penelope awaiting Ulysses’ return from the Trojan war. This subject from Greek mythology fit the Victorian notion of a woman’s role as homemaker and faithful wife."--http://www.nps.gov/edis/planyourvisit/upload/EDIS_S2_DisplayRes.pdf "Established in 1857, Llewellyn Park is listed in the National and State Historic Registers as both the first romantically landscaped and one of the first planned luxury estate communities in America." --http://www.llewellynpark.com/page/13266~93842/Highlights [work]
